project_abstract.cdata: The Mato Grosso State Privatization Project's main objective is to support Mato Grosso's reform efforts to enhance its efficiency in the delivery of public services through the privatization, restructuring or liquidation of state enterprises, and concessioning of public services. This includes the following fundamental reforms in the structure of the Government: the closure of the state commercial bank (BEMAT), the state housing agency, and the state development agency; privatization of the state power company; and decentralization and concession of water/sewerage services. This objective is consistent with the Country Assistance Strategy objectives of: (i) macroeconomic stabilization and public sector modernization; and (ii) increasing private participation in the provision of infrastructure. The project will include the following components: 1) privatization of the State Bank; 2) severance payments; 3) reform-related consultants, training, and equipment; 4) grants; 5) other incremental costs of reforms; and 6) high priority investments.
